articles.description: Three more patients have died at hospitals in Shropshire after testing positive for coronavirus.
articles.content:
They were all being cared for by Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust (SaTH), according to the latest figures from NHS England. 
The number of people who have died in the county's hospitals after contracting the virus now stands at 111.

articles.author: Sascha O'Sullivan
articles.title: Britain could ease lockdown for half the country if over-70s are shielded, scientists say - The Sun
articles.content:
BRITAIN could start to ease lockdown restrictions if over 70s stay shielded, scientists have said.
Researchers from Edinburgh University have said keeping the most vulnerable people inside could allow more than half of Britain to have restrictions relaxed.

articles.content:
